title: Basics of Financial Technology (Fintech)
headline: Learn how the fintech sector is revolutionizing traditional financial services with this free online finance course.
description: 'Financial technology' refers to the use of digital technology to deliver financial services such as making payments and obtaining financial advice to clients via their mobile phones or laptops. Millions of people use fintech everyday and this free online course looks at its successful evolution as well as its features and applications. It also covers challenges before delving into risk management and compliance requirements.

courseDescription:
Fintech is any technology that modifies, enhances, or automates financial services for people or corporations. We will take a closer look at how open banking and application programming interfaces (APIs) facilitate the growth of the fintech sector. We discuss the use and impact of innovations such as blockchain, artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML). You will uncover the main segment of the fintech landscape like mobile payments, digital lending and other services.

Additionally, we break down innovative fintech business models and gain insight into EU legislation such as PSD2 (Payment Services Directive 2). We look at the features and benefits of decentralized finance (DeFi) and explain the current and potential operational and management risks before learning how to handle them. We cover the best practices and requirements for fintech compliance and then outline the different methods in finance to identify potential fraud. Discover the use and importance of digital identity in fintech.

Finally, we explore the main components for the success of the fintech ecosystem, including supply-and-demand factors. We examine the future and look at the top five fintech startups shaping the industry. The fintech market was worth approximately US$112.5-billion in 2021 and is estimated to be US$332.5-billion by 2028. This course is for anyone interested in joining this fast-growing sector: itâ€™s a fantastic opportunity for future fintech specialists to gain theoretical expertise. Enrol now and start learning today!

Start Course Now

  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn the concept and evolution of Fintech with its challenges and risks. We explain open banking/API banking and the problem solved by Fintech. We cover the technologies used in Fintech, its application and features. Discover the main segments of the fintech landscape and several business models.

    • Outline the application and features of FinTech
    • Indicate the similarities and differences between DeFi and FinTech

  • Lesson Summary

    • FinTech refers to software, mobile applications and other technologies developed to enhance and automate conventional forms of finance for corporations and individuals.
    • Open Banking is a system in which banks open up their application programming interfaces, allowing third parties to access financial information needed to develop new apps and services while also giving account holders increased financial transparency.
    • Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) are the bridges that allow different software to interact and exchange data with each other.
    • PSD2 allows regulated third-party PISPs to initiate payments directly from customer payment accounts with the customer's consent.
    • PSD2 was released to promote the growth of payment systems and payment security. It controls access by unauthorized parties to client payment accounts.
    • General Data Protection Regulation is a regulation in EU law on data protection and privacy in the European Union and the European Economic Area.
    • Management risks with FinTech are focused on regulatory alteration risks and data governance concerns.
    • Operational risks with FinTech could be anything from market fluctuations, business liability, cyber risks, etc. 

  • Lesson Summary

    • FinTech refers to software, mobile applications and other technologies developed to enhance and automate conventional forms of finance for corporations and individuals.
    • Open Banking is a system in which banks open up their application programming interfaces, allowing third parties to access financial information needed to develop new apps and services while also giving account holders increased financial transparency.
    • Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) are the bridges that allow different software to interact and exchange data with each other.
    • PSD2 allows regulated third-party PISPs to initiate payments directly from customer payment accounts with the customer's consent.
    • PSD2 was released to promote the growth of payment systems and payment security. It controls access by unauthorized parties to client payment accounts.
    • General Data Protection Regulation is a regulation in EU law on data protection and privacy in the European Union and the European Economic Area.
    • Management risks with FinTech are focused on regulatory alteration risks and data governance concerns.
    • Operational risks with FinTech could be anything from market fluctuations, business liability, cyber risks, etc.
